description: This Java class named SeedConfig defines a Spring configuration component that seeds default integration records into the database during application startup. It utilizes Spring Boot's CommandLineRunner to execute the seeding logic, which ensures that specific integrations (like github, jira, slack) are present, avoiding duplicates through an idempotent approach.

classes.name: SeedConfig
classes.description: Spring configuration class responsible for seeding default integration data into the database on application startup

methods.name: seedIntegrations
methods.description: Defines a CommandLineRunner bean that seeds the default integrations into the database when the application starts

methods.name: saveIfMissing
methods.description: Checks if an integration with the given key exists; if not, creates and saves a new one with specified attributes
